item.title: NASA's Chandra Finds Galaxy Cluster Collision on a "WHIM"
item.description: Astronomers taking inventory of the material in the local universe keep coming up short. A new result from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory about a system of colliding galaxy clusters may help explain this shortfall.

item.title: NASA Webb's First Full-Color Images, Data Are Set to Sound
item.description: There's a new, immersive way to explore some of the first full-color infrared images and data from NASA's James Webb Space Telescope - through sound.

item.title: Chandra Shows Giant Black Hole Spins Slower Than Its Peers
item.description: Astronomers determine the spin of the black hole in H1821+643, making it the most massive one to have an accurate measurement of this fundamental property.

item.title: NASA's Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-ray Speed Trap
item.description: A young pulsar is blazing through the Milky Way at a speed of over a million miles per hour. This stellar speedster is one of the fastest objects of its kind ever seen.

item.title: NASA Telescopes Support Event Horizon Telescope in Studying Milky Way's Black Hole
item.description: As the Event Horizon Telescope collected data for its remarkable new image of the Milky Way's supermassive black hole, a legion of other telescopes including three NASA X-ray observatories in space was also watching.

item.title: Black Holes Raze Thousands of Stars to Fuel Growth
item.description: In some of the most crowded parts of the universe, black holes may be tearing apart thousands of stars and using their remains to pack on weight.

item.title: NASA Awards Postdoctoral Fellowships for 2022
item.description: NASA has selected 24 new Fellows for its prestigious NASA Hubble Fellowship Program (NHFP).

item.title: Tiny Star Unleashes Gargantuan Beam of Matter, Antimatter
item.description: Astronomers have imaged a beam of matter and antimatter that is 40 trillion miles long with NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory.

item.title: The Unfolding Story of a Kilonova Told in X-rays
item.description: Astronomers may have detected a sonic boom from a powerful blast known as a kilonova.

item.title: Chandra Resumes Science Observations
item.description: On Wednesday, Feb. 9, 2022, routine monitoring data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory indicated a power supply problem in the spacecraft's High Resolution Camera.
